intro: Clibadium glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth sumpweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along the edges of water bodies. Clibadium glabrescens is also known for its edible seeds, which have been used by indigenous peoples for food and medicinal purposes.
